website_summaries.verdict: For small beginner-level wood turning projects, like pens and small ornaments, this is a decent lathe. But it won’t tolerate larger wood projects, and users shouldn’t test its limits.
pros: Very reliable wood-turning lathe for the price
Low vibration and solid weight means some users didn’t even have to bolt the lathe to a solid surface
cons: Small size limits the type of work that can be done on this lathe
Some parts are plastic, and replacement can take months

customer_reviews.title: Nice machine.  Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy this thinking it was fairly cheap. I sold my big lathe and replaced with this one for making pens and other turning products. It came with a live center and 2 tool rests. Being able to speed it up or slow down with just turning a knob is a big improvement for me. All of my 3/4 x 16tpi accessories went right on as expected. It's really, really quiet. I'm glad I bought it. I've already made most of my money back in sales. Not sure of doing items that might be high torque etc, but this is excellent for fine for small turning projects.
customer_reviews.author: woodworker4315

customer_reviews.title: buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: easy to set up, turned about 30 pens and was happy with results, but the bar that steadies the carving tool keeps coming loose. After turning 30 pens, the bolt on top of the tailstock kept jumping the groove it's supposed to ride in, and I ended up sheering off the t-lock bolt, had to pay a machinist $120 to fix it, ordered a better lathe, not happy with this one's performance.
customer_reviews.author: A.Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Great machine! My husband has gotten into woodworking and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great machine! My husband has gotten into woodworking and lathe work and this was the perfect starter machine for him! He is doing pens and wine bottle stoppers and vases and all sorts of things. It is a little small and you can't do larger projects in it but to just get started and learn the trade it has worked perfectly. I haven't used the machine myself but I haven't heard any issues with the craftsmanship or hardware and my husband seems very happy with it.

customer_reviews.title: Broken pieces within first few months, no luck finding parts
customer_reviews.text: after owning this for only a few months, the hand wheel on the tail stock broke, as did both of the T- lock knob bolts. And although it has adapters for bowl turning, forget making hardwood bowls unless you have nice carbide tipped knives, and a very soft touch. Personally I hope to upgrade to a larger one soon, and sure will not be a Shop Fox. And good luck finding parts, the recommended dealers Woodstock International website recommends to contact for buying parts, do not even carry parts for this tool.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible design
customer_reviews.text: First off, the instructions absolutely suck. They don't do a good job at explaining functions or trouble shooting at all. My main issue with this lathe is the tailstock tightening knob. It's a horrible design and is very finicky. When the set screws were too loose, the knob would unscrew every time I tried to tighten my pen blank. If I did it too tight the screws would grind against the knob and strip it out. Maybe I just had a flawed product but I feel the design is horrible and I would not buy this product again.

customer_reviews.title: Keep shopping
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for turning chisel handles from lignum vitae. In future, my intent is to make other small items from varied woods. The worst problem in the method for retaining the rear material support: an Allen setscrew going into a groove in a shaft/hand wheel. In theory, the hand wheel is turned to drive the live center into the workpiece. In actual use, a mallet is needed. The unit seems underpowered for 1/3 HP, requiring the slightest cutting force. I’ll use this for very small turnings, after reworking the handscrew mechanism, but am restoring a full size Craftsman lathe. This was cheap, but turned out to be false economy. Spend a bit more on a well known brand.

I will likely get a MIDI lathe with MT-2 system next time.

customer_reviews.text: I had only one problem with the lathe,I needed to align the head with the center of the tail stock,after that the lathe has performed better than expected. I would like to see more adjustment in the speed control,so to me this is a great tool for the money
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer wildbill

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Have always liked wood turning. Was finally in a position to get a lathe. The only problem now is that I have the woodturning bug and want a bigger lathe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great first lathe!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this lathe for 4 months now and have turned about 50 pens on it. I really like it. It's easy to use, small enough for my limited bench space, and runs beautifully. UPDATE: Last night (06/09/13) the knob on the tail stock broke. Not sure how this happened but it did. This morning I called the tech support of the company that makes this lathe, gave them the serial #, model #, and part # along with the order date and order # from Amazon...within 5 minutes they said they were going to ship a new part to me within 3-5 business days!! I've increased my rating from 4 stars to 5 because of this excellent customer service!
customer_reviews.author: K. Koene

customer_reviews.title: Nice and quiet
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for my FIL and he loves it! Nice and quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Morin

customer_reviews.title: Love the product and can’t wait for my husband to ...
customer_reviews.text: Love the product and can’t wait for my husband to open it for his birthday! I would have given it 5 stars but it was delivered in just the product box. I would have preferred it wrapped in brown paper or put in another box. It’s easy enough for people to steal packages without showing them exactly what’s in the box.
customer_reviews.author: katherine

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised with this unit.
customer_reviews.text: The price for this unit was way less then other lathes with the same features like the variable speed so I wasn't sure what to expect. I was surprised by the quality of construction and how well everything lined up. I bought it for small projects like pens or small bowls and it works great. If you stay within the limits of the machine it works fine but would be under powered for large projects where you need to remove large amounts of wood. I am very happy and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Kovacic

customer_reviews.title: Great Small Wood Lathe at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box this little lathe performed flawlessly. Very smooth variable speed control with no vibration. Bought Amazon's recommended accessories i.e. the PSI 5 pc. chisel set and the book on "Learn to Turn". In 30 minutes I was turning 2"x2"x10" wood into spindle shapes. Great buy! Thanks Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Inganer

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Did not function out of the box. The slide would not lock down no matter what I did to it. Could not tighten. And believe me we tried everything under the sun. Including bolting a bar onto it to stop it. What a nightmare. Did not even get to craft a single piece on it. Piece of junk. Also the design of the tightening handle is useless if you are working with hard woods. You better have super strength to be able to turn that knob. There is nothing to grip. Don't waste your money. Buy a craftsman.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing- cast tailstock screw literally fell apart on first use. Will reach out to shop fox and see if they will do the right thing.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey D. Esposito

customer_reviews.title: Well built machine
customer_reviews.text: This is a well built machine with very few plastic parts. It's heavy for it's size and ideal for turning small pieces. The variable speed feature is very nice and has a good speed range. It is short on power and tends to stall rather easily at low speed but holds it's own when you get a good balance and can crank up the speed. It comes with a good manual and all the tools and attachments you need except a chuck.If your looking for a hobby lathe to turn small pieces I doubt you can find a better machine for the price. Free shipping was a real bonus too.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Shop fox wood lathe.
customer_reviews.text: I really nothing to compare it to, but for the price and shipment, it gets the job done. Very happy...
customer_reviews.author: Chris Diolata

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Pens
customer_reviews.text: I had a larger, non-VS lathe and decided to add something with variable speed just for pens. This lathe is just the ticket. It is small, but has more than enough power to handle the task. With speed changes by turning a knob rather than moving a belt around, the process goes much more smoothly also.To make it a "dream machine", change the Tapers from MT1 to MT2, simply because there are penmaking goodies for MT2. A great lathe for money.
customer_reviews.author: blindturner

customer_reviews.title: Received today. Read the manual. Ready to run ...
customer_reviews.text: Received today. Read the manual. Ready to run a test run . "Nothing". Motor not working. Pushed the circuit breaker and checked the fuse with an ohm meter. fuse ok. Not Happy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is a nice lathe for the size
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this too quickly. I am new to wood turning and didn't want to spend too much. It is a nice lathe for the size, and the variable speed works well, but if your doing anything other than small turning like pens, then go bigger. I put cedar log, about 3.5 inches in diameter, on it, and it struggle a little until I got it into round. After that, it worked fine. I will be upgrading soon. However, I will keep it the shop for the smaller things. I also purchased a Nova G3 chuck, and it makes the lathe that much better.
customer_reviews.author: zmartin

customer_reviews.title: great lathe for the beginner
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lathe to start your shop with. It won't do large projects but for a beginner it is great I pulled it out of the box checked the centers and turned a project the first night. The variable speed and power are great for making and polishing small projects. I think this would make a great Christmas gift for a weekend woodworker or a hobbyist.
customer_reviews.author: amikey73

customer_reviews.title: Minimum tool rest position too high for use with pen blanks
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this lathe for use turning wooden pens. However, the minimum height of the tool rest is too high to work. The minimum tool rest hits the center of the mandrel, so tools are always too high. There is way to adjust the tool rest lower. We are very disappointed.
